title: Lobster Rolls
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Lobster Rolls a try. This recipe makes 2 servings with 699 calories, 80g of protein, and 30g of fat each. For $24.99 per serving, this recipe covers 42% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 143 people have made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up two of lemon juice, lbs lobster meat, butter, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 10 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 91%. This score is amazing. Try Eating Out on Weight Watchers: The Lobster Lady Maine Lobster Rolls, Lobster Rolls (and Lobster Lessons), and New England Style Hot Dog Rolls/Buns (For Lobster Rolls Etc.) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Lobster works really well with Chablis and Chardonnay. Chablis is perfect with lobster, but a chardonny from other regions is bound to hit the spot too. One wine you could try is Domaine du Colombier Chablis. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 24 dollars.

productMatches.title: Domaine du Colombier Chablis
productMatches.description: A fruity and mineral wine.Pairs well with starters, cooked seafood, meats and snails.
